name: The Walls Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: I had a wonderful stay at The Walls. The B&B is newly refurbished, and sits directly on the wall surrounding Berwick. Eric and Suzanne were very attentive and kind. The room was very clean and comfortable, and breakfast was delicious. I look forward to staying there again.
reviews.title: Amazing B&B in Berwick upon Tweed

likes.liked: — The wonderful service and the beautiful room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at the Walls and had a great time. The room we were allocated was huge and beautifully furnished with a lovely ensuite shower room. Breakfast was also very good - a choice of fresh fruit salads and cereals and full english fry up or kippers.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — standard of furnishing and decor very high
likes.disliked: — could have had slightly more storage place for clothes - no chest of drawers in room, although there is a wardrobe

reviews.title: Can a B&B Get Any Better Than This????
reviews.text: Suzanne and family have clearly put a great deal of thought into doing up this elegant old building and it shows. Suzanne was a great host, welcoming and friendly and gave us excellent suggestions for eating out and things to do locally. Its a great place to base yourself if you want to explore the northumberland coast. For a B and B its extremely good value for money. This place sets a standard that most other providers can only aspire to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location, view, decor, hospitality, breakfast, etc, etc at The Walls was all truly exceptional. Eric and Suzanne are the friendliest, most welcoming hosts you could ask for and their home has been transformed into a fabulous place to stay with all the home comforts you could hope for.
reviews.title: A great place.

likes.liked: — The location and high standard of everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This, combined with the fact that there is a fantastic boozer within 2 minutes stumble, and the charming town of Berwick on your doorstep combine to make this the best place we've stayed in a very long time.
reviews.title: A great new B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were doing the Coast and Castles cycle route and very nearly didn't end up staying in Berwick at all. Most places wanted us to stay two nights, which is difficult when cycling from place to place. However, after visiting TripAdvisor, we tried The Walls, which were happy to offer us a nights stay, and better still could lock our bikes away in their basement.
reviews.title: Great B&B with welcoming hosts

likes.liked: — The attention to detail and great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great welcome from Suzanne and were taken to our room, Swan, which was huge with great views over the Tweed. The room was immaculately decorated with a huge sleigh bed, LCD TV with all the channels you could wish for (not a great pull for me but I'm sure there are people out there who would love that), bathrobes, a very clean and spacious bathroom all in a beautifully appointed grade II listed house.
reviews.title: Friendly, comfortable and a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was cooked by Suzanne and served by Eric, and there is plenty of it - cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurts, juice and a cooked breakfast. We don't eat meat or fish, but this didn't stop Suzanne who cooked us potato pancakes - excellent food.
reviews.title: Weekend at the Walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of eating out all I would like to say is don't eat at the Magna Tandoori on Bridge Street - get recommendations from Suzanne and Eric, which unfortunately we didn't do until the morning we were leaving!!! The Barrels pub round the corner from The Walls is great though. Alternatively you could sit in the front room and help yourself to drinks / snacks from the honesty bar (not something you find in England very often, but a great touch).
reviews.title: Quality Inn

likes.disliked: — Small wardrobe would be a squeeze for more than a night or so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hopefully soon Suzanne will open out her front room as a little tea / coffee shop, which she was telling us about. I think this would be an excellent idea and be a great addition to the town of Berwick... the location for this would be ideal as The Walls sits right on Quay Walls, part of the Rampart Walk.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B!!

description: The Walls is a beautiful and elegant period townhouse overlooking the Tweed Estuary, right on the Elizabethan Walls and in the tranquil heart of the old town of Berwick. Recently restored to its former Georgian splendour. The Walls offers luxurious comfort but with modern conveniences such as free Wi-Fi internet access and full Sky TV on large flat-screen TVs.
